topics.body: Just took apart a HK MP5, and now going to put it back together.

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54fc1f3e6368723e543c0b00#post_54fc1f3e6368723e543c0b00
[bq="EHAN"]"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54fc1ee063687240bd160d00#post_54fc1ee063687240bd160d00
It was useful way back in World War I and up to the 1970s energy crisis

But now it really has no use and needs to be abolished[/bq]

I don't see how it was ever useful to begin with. 

If businesses wanted their employees to get up sooner when the summer morning had more daylight, just tell them to come to work an hour earlier.

Why mandate that the entire world has to change the standard definition of "the present" every year?

It makes no sense

topics.body:
I just wrote a 1000 word essay and due to the fucking automatic logout system, all of that disappeared.

It was the most truthful and by far, greatest essay I ever wrote and it's all gone.

Just like that.

Poof. Gone.

I never felt this sad since last year after a whole year's worth of work disappeared due to a fallout in the washing machine.
